intro: Pseudarthria cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf grass or African heartleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, which is known for nitrogen-fixing abilities. Pseudarthria cordata typically grows in grasslands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
